Name: Noot vir Noot
Description:
Noot vir Noot is a board game based on a T.V. musical quiz game show in South Africa with the same name. It is the longest continually running television game show in the country with it's first broadcast in 1991 to present.

The aim of the game is to progress from the first block to the last "5 in a row" block. The player who arrives there first and correctly completes the task is the winner and receives the complete contents of the "kitty" as a prize.

Name: Topside Miniature Naval Warfare
Description:
These are the Topside Miniature Naval Warfare Rules accompany our naval miniature sets, and are offered as a basic framework for using and enjoying the miniatures. We tried for the emphasis on playability while giving the player a healthy does of realism.  If you are reading this sentence right now, you are probably reading it on paper or in electronic form, rather than written on stone. So read these rules, take the miniatures for a spin, and adjust the battle table to your liking. Season to taste, as the cookbooks say. And enjoy!

Our system allows for a complete interplay between air, naval and submarine combat without bogging down and killing the fun factor. The movement and combat rules are simple but they do add a level of complexity that will require some critical decision making throughout the game. Our goal was to have you focus on the critical decision tree the rules will present you with - and not fight the rules!

A scenario book covering 17 WWII naval battles is available for pdf download.

Name: Flinkdink
Description:
Flink Dink features an electronic buzzer component. An electronic umpire is integrated with a colorful playing board. The game provides for three to seven persons the chance to enjoy the excitement of the South African TV show at home.

The objective of the game is to amass the greatest value of prizes by correctly answering the various general knowledge questions provided.

Name: Just Like Mama Used to Say: Going to Church!
Description:
Better than Sunday Donuts and Punch!  50 New Cards that are funnier than Paw Paw snoring during the sermon!  25 action cards & 25 phrase cards to add to your Just Like Mama Used to Say Original game.

The game is best played with 3 or more people.  Players compete to build the most entertaining Southern phrase.

Mix and match action cards with phrase maker cards to create thousands of combinations.

Name: Just Like Mama Used to Say: The Back to School Expansion Pack
Description:
50 New Cards that are funnier than Mrs. Garvey throwing chalk at Billy!  25 action cards & 25 phrase cards to add to your Just Like Mama Used to Say Original game.

The game is best played with 3 or more people.  Players compete to build the most entertaining Southern phrase.

Mix and match action cards with phrase maker cards to create thousands of combinations.

Name: Fringo
Description:
Fringo is a guess the word party game, with the usual approach of one team member trying to describe the word to others, but there is one catch: the description needs to be in the form of questions.

If the word was 'Germany', the description could be "What is a big country in the Central Europe? Which country's capital is Berlin?" and so on.

The words are categorized into five classes: around the world, animals and nature, famous people, sports, and history. At the start of the game each team gets a board with squares with category names, which are then filled with tokens of corresponding categories.

Teams then take turns with rotating member as the one who tries to get the team to guess the words of needed categories. They can explain as many words as they manage as long as there is time sand timer. Afterwards the team can flip as many category tokens as they guessed words correctly. First team to flip all of them wins the game.

Name: Bequest: Promo Pack #1
Description:
This promotional set contains two cards:

     Brainstorm
     Professor Emerald


It is contained in _Game Trade Magazine_ # 258.

Name: Aeon's End: Promo Pack 1
Description:
This small promo comes with Promos P1-P3 which are Basic Nemesis cards (T1 Attack, T2 Power, T3 Power). Also included are 3 Market Setup cards (6 total setups, front and back).

Basic Tier 1 - Menace (Attack)
Basic Tier 2 - Gravity Splinter (Power)
Basic Tier 3 - World Purge (Power)

reissued in Aeon's End: War Eternal promo pack.

Name: Darkness Rising
Description:
You play a ranger who is trying to save villagers by navigating through a wilderness that is rapidly being taken over by a dark force. Luck and strategy are required to survive the journey and fight the monsters.

You must navigate by rolling a dice and filling in the hex grid with the corresponding pathways. Every round one hex is eliminated making it harder to navigate. When the pathways go out of bounds you must fight monsters by rolling dice and matching each monsters pattern. Your goal is to collect as many villagers as you can and navigate to safety. Sometimes you must make the hard decision to sacrifice your villagers to the monsters and elements so that you can survive.

—description from the designer

Name: Spell Binders Grimoire
Description:
A solo game where you must successfully harness the energy of the elements to casts spells.

This is a solo roll and write that takes up to 15 minutes to play. Using dice you get values that correspond to markings on a spell sheet that is set in a circle, you connect those points and attempt to trap the element within and make specific patterns with the connecting lines.

—description from the designer

Name: Peekaboo sesamstraat
Description:
Peekaboo sesamstraat is a memory game with pictures of sesame street.

6 colored tiles with small holes are placed over the sesame street pictures. The player on turn trows the 6 colored die and has to guess which picture is under the corresponding colored tile.

In the end the player with the most correct guessed pictures wins.

—user summary

Name: Dicelympics
Description:
A free print&play dice game for 2-8 players where players compete in 10 different events.

Each of the 10 events will have one or multiple winners, the player who wins the most events will take home the Golden Dicelympics Medal

Luck, dexterity and picking the right opponent are all required to win.

—description from the designer

Name: Snack Wars
Description:
Snack on the go!

Players take on the role of gluttonous globe-trotting raccoons who are a little prone to thieving!
During your turn, you must draw several cards and choose the ones you want to keep in your 9-card collection. Choose wisely in order to assemble the culinary specialties that will allow you to score the most points at the end of the game, but be careful, as opponents might come to loot your hoard!

—description from the publisher

Name: Deception: Undercover Allies – Kickstarter Edition
Description:
This Kickstarter exclusive edition comes in a larger-sized box which is big enough to hold all content from the base game, expansion, promos and accessories. It contains:


     Deception: Undercover Allies expansion
     Deception: Undercover Allies â€“ Kickstarter Pack (1 new Role card, 13 new Clue cards and 10 Means cards)
     Moulded plastic insert
     All stretch goals


This KS exclusive version of Deception: Undercover Allies brings more Means cards, Clue cards, Scene tiles, Events, and Roles to your investigation. All of these new cards were designed with the goal in mind of bringing more balance to the Murderer’s chosen weapons. The expansion adds many more cards to make the less chosen causes of death (like Illness/Disease) more viable options, adding more uncertainty to the game and creating more interesting end game narratives.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Deception – Murder in Hong Kong

Name: Incognito
Description:
Hide your drawing!

A banana at granny’s, a hat in space… take your pencils, ready? Scribble!

Each turn, players must hide an item in a place. You have to succeed in hiding it (but not too much) so that some players still manage to find it (but not all of them). Once players have hidden their word, they will try to find their opponents’ hidden words.

—description from the publisher

Name: Legacy Quiz
Description:
The fun part in each trivia game is answering new questions. So gather cards from your trivia games and let's start having fun.

Players ask questions from various trivia games. The first player answering the question correctly gets a point.   
When all questions on a card are asked this card will never be needed again. So destroy the card.

After all questions have been asked exchange the coins into dice. Throw the dice. The higher result wins.

The legacy part in this game is not only that the cards are destroyed but that rules may change over time as they have to be adapted according to the used questions cards and your gaming group.

—description from the designer

Name: Capt'n Sharky: Die Schatzkammer
Description:
Capt'n Sharky has been on a great voyage and has found many beautiful things for his friends, which now have to be stowed away as well as possible in the treasure chamber.

Each player gets 21 treasures and 2 wooden planks. Each player first places two wooden planks horizontally or vertically in the opponent's half of the treasure chamber. Then the players each take turns placing one of their treasures in the treasure chamber and try to place as many as possible. The treasures may touch each other, but not lie on top of each other. When placing the treasures, remember that the treasure map and anchor each score two points, and the other treasures each score one point. If no player can place more treasures, the value of the treasures is added and the player with the more valuable collection wins.

—user summary
Families: Versions & Editions: Travel Versions of Non-Travel Games

Name: Arcadia Quest: Monkey Queen
Description:
What began as an arranged marriage with Wukong blossomed into love, or so Yuling imagined. The Queen is more than a little put out with Wukong dumping her with the kids and an ungovernable kingdom of apes to traipse off on some stupid adventure. Placing the first minister (a baboon with a rather fetching red bottom) in charge, the Queen has journeyed to Arcadia to drag her husband hime, and pity any foolish vampires that stand in her way!

Monkey Queen is a promotional character for Arcadia Quest.

Name: Arcadia Quest: Koba
Description:
Insatiably curious since an early age, Koba demonstrated an obsession for anything and everything related to adventure. Swords, spells, sneaking… you name it, she wanted to master it. When adventurers would stay at her grandparents' tavern, she'd virtually appear next to them wherever they went, and hound them for tales of adventure and monster-slaying techniques. Some indulged her precociousness. Others did not, and she has an intense dislike for anyone that she suspects is hiding something from her. When she was of age, she shouldered her swords, staffs, and daggers (quite a trick) and marched off for a life of adventure and excitement in the distant land called Arcadia.

Promotional character for Arcadia Quest.

Name: Arcadia Quest: Pluck
Description:
When he was seven years old, Pluck managed not to die. Which was, in fact, incredible considering his burgeoning affinity with fire magic, and his rather excitable pyromaniacal nature. In fact, if his parents hadn’t been wealthy enough for a cinder-stone house, they likely would’ve all perished within the year. While it seemed Pluck was on the fast-track to a University scholarship, he never exhibited much desire to learn more magic than it took to create a small open flame. He greatly preferred watching things burn, and experimented at length, noting particularly the flammability of certain mixtures and chemicals. Now he works as a loyal and happy Guildsman, so long as he’s allowed some leeway with regard to collateral damage.

Promotional character for Arcadia Quest.

Name: Arcadia Quest: Prince Aaron
Description:
For a crown prince that always leads from the front, it's amazing that Prince Aaron is still alive, let alone as relatively unscathed as he is. Unusually Blessed, it's perhaps because of his invincible reputation that those that follow him are so inspired, and his opponents so cowed (or perhaps it's because of his incredibly loud shouty voice). Nothing will stand in his way to reclaiming the throne for the glory of the royal family! Just keep that shady Newt fella away from him.

Promotional character for Arcadia Quest.

Name: Chivalheart: Uprising
Description:
Chivalheart: Uprising is a card-driven strategy wargame for two players to enjoy over approximately ninety minutes per session with high replayability. It is proudly an “Amerigame”, meaning that the narrative is at the core of the experience. In Chivalheart: Uprising, one player assumes the role of the imperialistic Seren while the other becomes the desperate Rebels with the latter’s homeland providing the battlefield(s). The two factions are highly asymmetrical and feature different strengths: the Rebels have superior numbers and means of maneuvering around the map, while the Seren start with control of all settlements and are fundamentally more dangerous combatants.

—description from the designer

Name: Cake Auf!
Description:
Cake Auf is a take-that, recipe fulfilling card game best for 2-4 people, perfect for families and parties!

In Cake Auf, you play as a chef juggling multiple recipes at once. Each recipe has a star value: 1 star to 3 stars, rated based on difficulty. Finish a recipe and you collect the number of stars on the recipe. The first player to reach 5 stars wins!

Name: Mint Mini
Description:
Mint Mini  is bringing players back into Mintopia with mini-games designed around the mechanics of previous Mint entries. A dice drafting game that is built to give you a taste of each Mint Mechanic. Draft Works, and you play a mini worker placement, Draft Delivery and you will deliver Mints, and so on.

Welcome Back to Mintopia!

—description from the designer

This Game never actually delivered to backers because the company went bancrupt. So besides a few pre-production copies for reviewers, it is non-existent at this point.

Name: Destroy COVID
Description:
Destroy COVID is a cooperative, puzzle-solving board game that players can play in the safety of their homes. Be a member of an international research team and develop a vaccine against COVID to defeat the pandemic. Find the solution fast to keep the number of infected people to a minimum. Communicate effectively and work as a team to save the world.

The boxes contain puzzles similar to ones found in popular escape room games. However, the elements are non destructive, so you can give it to your friends after you finished the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Flags: Stories From The Eye Of The Sea
Description:
"Ahoy me hearties, have I a story for ye! Years ago I was the high captain of a grand fleet of ships. The world was the helm of me ship, and I had her in the palm of me hand. Then, a warring storm came upon us before we knew it and in a flash me entire fleet was sleeping in the depths of Davy Jones' Locker. As luck would have it, myself and a hand full of me scallawags managed to stay afloat on a raft made from empty rum barrels. For days we were adrift, thirsty, hungry, and scorched by the sun. Of the original crew only myself and three others survived the trial. We were saddened by the loss of our brothers and sisters at sea, yet somehow smiles found us again as we finally stepped upon the shores of an uncharted desert island. The island was just rich enough with fresh water and resources to support the four of us. After years on the island, we missed our old life so much, that we came up with this game to remind us of who we once were. Other than our bones, it is all that remains of a life that once was."

Black Flags is a competitive table-top game which uses a unique rondel system, story telling, dice rolling, and narrative choice to transport players to a fantasy world of piracy, commerce, and nautical adventure.

Players take turns in clockwise fashion until a player takes the last gold coin from the bank. When this occurs, the game immediately ends. The player with the most gold wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Alphabetizing
Description:
Players attempt to fill columns with words in alphabetical order from top to bottom. Players first start by lacing five randomly chosen words, face down, to place onto the board in the red center positions. These words may never be moved, and determine what words can go above and below them on the board.

For example, if a red word is “Freeze”, all words placed above must come before freeze alphabetically. All words below it must come after alphabetically.

After these words are placed, players take turns picking from face down cards that contain other words, and place them in such a way that they can successfully fill a column. There are also blank cards which act as wild cards and 10 point bonus cards which just give a player a point bonus.

If a player completes a column, they get bonus points. Any player who draws a word that cannot go on the board loses points. Each player may also once per game move a blue space word to make room for s word they have drawn. Player with the most points when the game is over is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Play the Pub Quiz Family Edition
Description:
A game of two teams allowing players to compete in a pub quiz in the comfort of their own home. Categories consist of History, Sport, Music & Film.

—user summary

Name: I Want the Truth!
Description:
Players are given a category and three potential facts. They score points by identifying the correct fact. A correct answer scores 1 point, and the first player to 15 points wins.

—user summary

Name: Vocabulary Building
Description:
Players try to give correct definitions to words in order to advance their spaceship back to Earth. Spaces either require a player to pick Intergalactic cards or Earth cards, which require them to either advance on the board or define a word. The first player to have left Earth, visited Granada and returned to Earth (by exact count) is the winner.

—user summary

Name: A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic – Deadly Fields
Description:
Towering over the sweeping cornfields, the ominous windmill creaks and sways as its blades turn in the dark autumn sky. There are evils that lurk within the fields, and a darkness growing below the mill’s musty wooden floor.

This 16 card supplement for Dark Gothic is themed around the Windmill location as well as the cornfields that surround it. With new cards for Minions, Allies, Gear, and Events, it also features a new Special Location card type for the Cornfields. Sitting below the center line when revealed, the Cornfields gives an extra risk and reward to players that acquire any of the cards above it…collected from within the sinister, maze-like crops that have dried and withered with the taint of evil.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic

Name: ウリニゲセブン (Sell Out Seven)
Description: As a miserly store owner, you want to provide the least amount of sausage in your hot dog buns as possible while still displaying the most enticing hot dog in the market. After all, you don't want to be left with unsold product. By using clay as the bread and different lengths of wire as the sausage, you will design five different hot dogs for your store, some of which may not even have a sausage at all! Then your fellow store owners will snake draft the sausages from other stores that they find enticing. At the end of four choices for everyone, the contents of the hot dogs are revealed. Those owners who held back or had the most unsold sausage lose points, and finally the positive points from everyone else's sausages are added up. Beware the very short sausages: those are great decoys, but worthless for scoring!

Name: Eine Menge Kinder
Description:
In Eine Menge Kinder, all players compete simultaneously by playing cards from their hands fitting changing criteria. It aims at preschool kids to help them improve their understanding of set theory.

The cards are divided into illustrated "element cards" showing different looking children and "symbol cards". All element cards are dealt to the players and the symbol cards form a drawing pile. Each round one or two symbol cards are placed on the table, depending on the difficulty you prefer. Then everybody plays from their hands cards fitting the shown rules. For example "glasses" symbol tells you to only play cards showing children with glasses. It continues this way until one player has no cards left and is declared the winner.

The instructions come with different rules to increase the difficulty by introducing intersecting sets or by finding ore similarities between the children on your own.

—user summary

Name: Backyard Birds: Wetlands
Description:
In 2018 we decided to include a waterfowl expansion for Backyard Birds. Originally we planned on adding about 20 different waterfowl species; however, we quickly realized that the expansion could easily be made into its own standalone game. We added an additional 20 species and significantly changed the game mechanics from the original Backyard Birds.

Capture as many wetland territory cards as possible using carefully assembled flocks of waterfowl birds. Territory and waterfowl cards award victory points and the most victory points at the end of the game wins.

On your turn, a player can perform one of six actions, acquruing territory, enabling abilities or events.  If none of these can be done, the decks can be shuffled instead.

The game will end after the last wetland territory is revealed from its supply pile then all players play one more round.
Add up the victory points for your wetlands and the waterfowl on the wetlands. Remember to make any adjustments from event cards. Waterfowl in your game area will not score.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Kingdom Faction Pack
Description:
One of the safest places left in the known world, the Kingdom is guarded by well-trained and well-equipped cavalry. These stalwart soldiers are led by the Kingdom’s chief of security and Ezekiel’s right-hand man, Richard.

Contents:
1x Resin Richard Model
1x Resin Benjamin Model
2x Kingdom Guards
19 All Out War Cards including: 4 Survivor Cards, 13 Equipment Cards, 2 Veteran Skill Cards
15 Call to Arms Cards including: 5 Survivor Cards, 1 Faction Rules Card, 9  Equipment Cards
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: Dracula
Description:
The game contains two different variants: one game for two people and one for 2 to 4 people.

In the 2-player game, each player alternately moves one of his figures. The "villager" may only move one space horizontally or vertically onto an unoccupied space. The "vampire" player is also only allowed to move one square, horizontally and vertically. But he may also hit by jumping, also diagonally. The winner is the player who met his or her victory condition.

The 2 - 4 person variant is a modified Halma with its familiar move and victory options.

Name: Give me A++
Description:
Brrrringggggggg (School Bell Rings)

The exam is going to start in 5 minutes. This is a game that every student will try to take a exam in the same classroom. Whoever can get the 100 points (A++), he/she will be the winner of the game.

Before the game starts, players need to choose which colors they would like to represent. There will be a surprise if you can win the game.

During the gameplay, there will be two phase. First phase is [Card Placing]. Players need to take turn placing one of the card on the empty seat. How many turns to play is based on how many players in the game, 2/3/4/5/6 players, 4/3/2/2/2/ cards will be on the gameboard.
Second phase is [Resolution], players flip over all the cards on the gameboard and start resolve them by order. Every fun situation will occur during this phase. Players will +/- points by cards effect. Whoever can get the 100 points during the game is the winner.

Name: Maya: Indianische Spiele aus Altamerika
Description:
Maya is a game collection of three Indian games based on ancient America for 2 to 4 people: Patolli, Quippu, Yucatan.

Patolli is a running game with a peculiar dice mechanism: two players each receive a knotted cord and hide any number of knots in their right hand and cover the rest with the left. Then it is revealed at the same time and the number of visible nodes must be The players "roll the dice" with the knotted cords and then move their figures (semi-precious stones). The player who passed the cross (game board) first wins the game.

Quippu is played with the knots and is a pure puzzle game. 
Yucatan is only played in pairs and only with the semi-precious stones. It is a puzzle game in which one player puts together a combination of three stones from two semi-precious stones and the other player has to guess it.

Name: Yunomi
Description:
A trivia game where the questions are about the other players! Every time you play the game the answers change and you learn something you didn’t know about your friends!

In each round, one player is in the ‘spotlight’ (SP) and the others have to answer questions about them. Questions range from easy (what is the SP’s dog’s name?) to esoteric (does the SP believe in life on other planets?).

If you get it right, you move on the board the number of spaces specified on the question card, get it wrong, you don't move. The next round the question will be about the next person in the circle and on and on it goes until somebody reaches the finish line.

Name: Macaron: Kickstarter Expansion Pack
Description:
The Kickstarter Exclusive Promo Expansions:


     Baristo Expansion - More betting tracks
     Emma Expansion - Solo play
     Jester (aka Royal?) Expansion - Get a box if the trick has a smaller even card  
     The King’s Orders Expansion - A quest for royal pâtissiers
     Noble Expansion -  Events that make every round refreshing
     Zero Expansion - Negative cards that will give you points if you have more of them
     Sunset wild card - wins any card played by the previous player.

Name: Get the Picture: The Head-to-Head Dot-to-Dot Race
Description: Each team inserts the same copy of a picture into their pad, and reveal the first numbers to connect to, then write their guess of what the picture is. They reveal another set of numbers and keep going until the picture is done. Then they compare their gueses and whoever guest the soonest correctly wins.

Name: Don't Look Back: Supporting Characters Expansion
Description:
No horror experience is complete without a solid foundation of supporting characters to lift the main characters or succumb to the terrors of the night. Will they survive the encounter and become a powerful ally in the future; or an insidious nemesis? Only time will tell!

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 6 Supporting Character miniatures and optional rules for using these supporting characters to the base game.

Name: Caporetto 1917
Description:
For sure the most famous battle on the Italian Front during the Great War, and a pivotal event of the war on this front. "Caporetto 1917" is a confrontation between two different ways to make war: infiltration tactics against static defense.

Caporetto 1917 is the third wargame on a battle on the Italian Front, after Strafexpedition, 1916 and Gorizia 1916, using the same system and scale. 
It will have a series rule book, with the 2nd edition rules, usable for both Strafexpedition 1916 and Gorizia 1916, with consolidated errata and a more detailed artillery use. The Specific Rules will cover the game scenario itself, with rules dedicated to this battle and where game turns will be 12 hours long (instead of one day per GT). In the historical campaign game there is no way for the Italians to win; the two players, or teams, will play the Austro-German and Italian right wing, against the Austro-German and Italian left wing. In detail, Krauss and Stein Groups attacking the Italian IV Corps, and Berrer and Scotti Groups attacking the Italian VII Corps and part of the XXVII.

The map will run from Mount Canin and Rombon on the West to Tolmino bridgehead on the East, and from Plezzo and Monte Nero on the North to Cividale and the Friuli plains on the South. It will be divided in sectors where each player, or team, will have to achieve its objectives faster than the opponent.

The campaign game will be big, with 2 maps, and over 1000 units and markers, but short, from October 24th to October 27th, when general Cadorna gave the order of general withdrawal in front of an unrecoverable situation. By that time, after 8 Game Turns, the Austro-German troops should have run across the whole map. Caporetto campaign game is a rush, but also a study of two different approaches to warfare in World War One. In Caporetto 1917 you will find units and specializations from the former two games, beside Stosstruppen, Arditi, gas and mine attacks, and more. Small scenarios will cover specific episodes of this epic confrontation, and an alternative campaign game, with Austro-German and Italian counterparts, where the Italian player can freely deploy its reserves (only), and can test if the battle could have gone better for the Italian colors.

Welcome to the mobile warfare in the Great War.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: WW1 Battles on the Italian Front (ES)

Name: ATS Bloody Buna
Description:
New Guinea, 1942, and the American 126th and 128th Infantry Regiments, 32nd Infantry Division are up against it.  Fighting alongside the Australian 18th Brigade they faced not only oppressive heat humidity and insects but also disease, as malaria and dengue swept through their ranks (accounting for twice as many casualties as were lost in battle).  Let's not forget their reason for being in New Guinea... to wrestle control of the Pacific island from the heavily entrenched Japanese.
In this package:
18 map panels (17x11 inches each) depicting historical terrain
11 scenarios
A Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules
2 half-sheets of Japanese personnel, weapons and AFVs

Players will need to have at-hand their ATS rulebook and charts as well as US Army and Commonwealth Army personnel, weapons and vehicles (Bren Carriers and Stuart I tanks)

Name: ATS Utah Beach: D-Day On The Cotentin Peninsula
Description:
The Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) returns to Normandy for an entirely different experience than the earlier Omaha, Juno and King Red offerings.  Here, there are no enemy positions stationed on high ground, this coastal area being relatively flat with a 4-to-8 foot cement wall along the beach.  Make no mistake, however, the area was heavily defended by the German 919th Grenadiers and 709th Infantry Division. Getting ashore (yes, there is a monster, 48-turn invasion scenario) is only half the battle and tactical simulation fans will enjoy the unique maps depicting the Cotentin Peninsula and the flooded farmland inland from the beach itself.

What You'll Receive:
16 map panels, each 17x11 inches
11 scenarios, the last being the aforementioned 48-turn affair
A 14-page Battlefield Walkaround with module-specific rules and an extensive historical breakdown

What You'll Need:
Standard ATS rules and charts
ALL necessary counters including German and American personnel, weapons, AFVs, weapons nests and US Landing craft, either from the Normandy modules you already own or via the special counter set, available separately.

This version is for owners of the latest ATS OMAHA, ATS UTAH Counter Collection and the ATS Rulebook 2014 and later, plus small and large system markers. Includes Landing Craft Play Aid, 8 scenarios, BW Rules in color and color folio.

Name: Perpetuity
Description:
Perpetuity, an artificial star with a system of orbiting planets is misbehaving and slowly sinking into chaos.  The inhabitants of the system will soon be lost to oblivion.  Time is short, resources are scarce and heroes are desperately needed.

Perpetuity: Grave Descent is a science fiction worker placement game for 1-5 players and plays Cooperatively, Competitively and Solo. Each round players place workers on work tiles to collect resources, repair damaged tiles, upgrade tiles, build ships and eventually fly missions to evacuate alien villages on the dying planets.  Players must navigate a quickly changing game where lower level workers become less effective.  Players must balance choices between keeping systems operational and spending limited resources on ships and rescue missions.

"Perpetuity" itself (the artificial star) can be played by one of the players or a set of A.I. cards.  Perpetuity in both cases works against the other players and attempts to hinder their evacuation efforts by unlocking abilities in Gravity, Space, Time and Matter.

In Cooperative play, players race to save all the alien villages and workers.  If any are lost when a planet is destroyed, the game ends in failure.

In Competitive play, players vie for the most victory points by maximizing opportunities for points with repairs, exploration, evacuations and collecting resources.

Name: Kesselfüllen
Description:
An enchanting story to play with for all those who love magic. With magic wand and 25 gems.

I am kili the witch and present you with the magical and funny game "Kesselfüllen".

Whoever gets kicked out wins!

You just have to get kicked out and you've won!
But it's not always that easy!

The somewhat different game for the whole family, kindergartens and primary schools.
An educationally valuable game.

Name: Tridu
Description:
A game with a glass board, black and white glass stones and three dice.

No further information about this game could be found online.

Name: Das GROSSE Alfred J. Kwak Freundschaftsspiel
Description:
Relive the adventures of the famous Alfred Jodocus Kwak and his friends with this exciting board game!

Alfred has disappeared. Kra tells us that Alfred fell down the well, but won't reveal where this well is. As Alfred's good friend, you naturally set out to help him and experience all kinds of exciting adventures.

To get Alfred out of the well, you must first have three friendship cards. Will you be the first to find the well and gather three of Alfred's friends around you? Or will Kra snatch a friendship card from you at the last moment...? By gathering friends around you and carrying out the orders well, you will - a deal is a deal - reach the goal the fastest!

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Name: GUATAFAC 'Unos Vicios'
Description:
THE SPICIEST VERSION OF GUATAFAC! 480 new cards and very daring tests!

âš¡ï¸ SIMPLE RULES: Discover the worst thoughts of players in 8 seconds with this hilarious board game. Win points by answering correctly before your time ends! 
The one who's answered more questions correctly in time wins the game :)

PLAY IN 15 TO 45 MIN, from 2 to 15 players and MILLIONS of possible answers. +16 years.

â™»ï¸ CARDS PRINTED IN THE EUROPEAN UNION with paper from sustainably managed forests. 1% of the profits are donated to charities. (FEDER, 2021)

—description from the publisher

Name: New York Zoo: Solo zoo board Spielbox Promo
Description: A double-sided solo board, part of the Spielbox 4/2021 issue

Name: OMAIGOD 'Hazme El Humor'
Description:
SUPER FUNNY, a new board game to laugh out loud!

âš¡ï¸ Simple to play: Answer to daily talks and messages how you would never dare to! 
Win points by combining the funniest question-answer cards. The one who earns more points by finding the best combinations wins the game!


     Play in 15-45min with 3-15 players, you will have millions of possible combinations to answer. 
     Created by the greatest Toño & Pablo, authors of Guatafac. 
     FREAKING FUNNY: 480 cards with hot questions, answers and pictures! 


â™»ï¸ Cards printed in the European Union with paper from sustainably managed forests. 1% of the profits are donated to charities. (ERDF in 2021)

—description from the pubisher

Name: Sirocco
Description:
The object of Sirocco is to move the 6 pawns to the diagonally opposite field which is marked by a bar in your own color. On the way, you must try to take as many pawns from your opponents as you can. Since captured pawns from opponents have more value than your own pawns which have been brought into the opposite goal, the pursuit of the opponent is the hallmark of sirocco.

Each player receives 6 pawns in one color, which he places on the starting space of the same color. 
One throws in turn (clockwise) and advances one of his pawns the number of points thrown.
One's own pawns and those of opposing players may be jumped over. The grey dots form the neutral starting space. pawns of the opponent may not be knocked over in this space.

Important: You must first move all 6 pawns from the grey neutral space into the green playing field (= onto the green lines) before you can make a move or capture with a pawn that is already in the green space.

Once all pawns have been moved into play (i.e., no pawn may be on the starting spot, base, or on the gray dots), one may move into the playing field. On the playing fields, players move from point to point, provided they are connected by lines. It is not possible to move an opponent's pawn on red-bordered spots, because these spots are protected. One may move one's own pawn back, but one may not return to one's own neutral square.

The game ends when a player has lost all his pawns or has moved them into the base (= the large colored circle). Each player then counts the points he has scored. 
The following points are scored: - captured pawn of an opponent 

     Captured pawn of an opponent: 3 points.
     own pawn in the opposite corner: 2 points
     A pawn of your own that is already in the neutral opposite field but not yet in the base: 1 point


Pawns which are still in the playing field at the end of the game have no value. The player who scores the most points wins the game.

Name: Terra Colonia
Description:
Do you know your way around Cologne? And if not? Never mind! In this game, you can also get ahead by guessing - even if it's only by guessing your fellow players well. Discover the megacity on the Rhine in a playful way!

Cologne offers in 86 'Veedeln'(quarters) much known, but also surprises. However, if you already have a clue, you have good chances to score a lot of points: What is the largest brewery in Cologne? When was the chocolate museum opened? Which neighborhoods have an area code other than 0221? And how many employees does Cologne-Bonn Airport actually have?

One player is the guessing master, and only he has to answer the question posed to him by his challenger. All the other players decide whether they think the answer is right or wrong. But beware! The estimation master can also reject the question. In that case, the challenger must take the guessing stone in his own hand - at a higher risk, of course. Who accepts the challenge?

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Those who already have a clue, however, have a good chance of scoring a lot of points. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Homo Vivo
Description:
Homo Vivo is a board game for 2 to 5 players where the players manage a tribe and have it evolve from australopithecus to homo sapiens sapiens.

The first player to reach the stage of homo sapiens sapiens is the homo vivo, the surviving man, and wins the game.

Rules in Dutch/Flemish.  Player boards in English. Resource cards and board are language neutral.

Name: Neko Tobashi
Description: First you assemble the tower then catapult cats of various sizes counting points depending on where they land.

Name: Towers of Yoma
Description:
Towers of Yoma is a cooperative Tower Defense game, inspired by the genres warcraft heritage.

The races of Yoma unite to save the last valley from the steamed people.
Build mazes, upgrade towers and explore synergies between multiple fantasy factions and their unique playstyles.

All in all, Yoma can be described as a top down strategy game. You use Action Points to build towers and shoot neighbouring fields within your maze. Throughout the campaign, you and your friends will have to destroy all creeps before they reach the end of your valley(-map) in 8 missions with 2 to 4 waves of a handful of creeps each.

The game comes with 4 races, 6 race specific towers each to place and stack. Every player holds one player board and one of 8 general cards that have one unique ability each. E.g. Imp Meyer, is exclusively be allowed to deconstruct towers without spending action points.
The games map is modular and allows for various scenarios and even custom community challenges.

Game modes:
Full coop
1 Creep Master vs Many

—description from the designer

Name: Zakręcone robale
Description:
Tile-laying game - who can make the longest worm?

The game consists of tiles with sections of different-coloured worms on each tile. Players play tiles to the shared tableau and score points when the tile they add completes a worm. A proper worm must at least have a head and a tail but the longer the worm the more points you get!

—user summary

Name: Wer kann rechnen?
Description:
Similar to the classical children's game Lotto. The children have to solve math problems, sometimes with farm animals, sometimes with numbers, sometimes with abstract shapes.

—user summary

Name: Die Biene Maja: Blumenfest
Description:
In this game with 30 cards (motifs of Maya the Bee and her friends) are offered two variants. Duo is for two players, both have a face down deck of cards, the top one is revealed, the better card in terms of symbols wins both cards. Trio is played by three players, each has 10 cards of the same suit, again all reveal a card, the better card wins the other cards of the round, which card is the better, again the symbols decide. The winner is the one who could collect the cards of the opponents.

—user summary

Name: Wortpoker
Description:
The game consists of 110 cards with 40 vowels and 70 consonants. The aim of the game is to continue as long a word as possible by placing letters, but not to finish. Each player gets 2 vowels and 5 consonants. The starting player uncovers a consonant card from the deck and places one of his letter cards to the right or left and adds a new card to his hand. If the next player believes that no valid word can be formed with the letters on display in the given order, he can challenge the display. 
A penalty point is awarded to anyone who is justifiably doubted, to anyone who doubts incorrectly, and to anyone who finishes a word. The player with the fewest penalty points wins.

—user summary

Name: Sakura: Character promo card
Description:
This is a unique promo card for Sakura published by A-games.
This card was included in the issue 100 of JEM magazine (i.e. Magazine of Players) in Hungary.

The card has 2 different sides:
- Side II: The player with the most points in the first round gets it. In round 2, when it's your turn, you can use a 6th character card, which you put under 5th, and you can hire that too for 5 money. At the end of your turn, if you haven't hired a character, you discard this. If you hired one, but not this, you have to push it further as card 6.
- Side III: At the end of the 2nd round, the player with the most points gets it. In round 3, when it's your turn, you can buy a character for 1 less money. Replacing characters is also one money cheaper. You get the character in the first place for free.

Name: Schachtett
Description:
Teach children the game of chess in a playful way with SchachTett, the first quartet to chess.

Each player gets 6 cards. With more than 8 players, each player should get 4 cards. Decide whether to play the easy or the more difficult variant (pawns / knights = easy, rook / queen = difficult).

The goal of the game is to "win" one card of each category by answering the questions and thus get a quartet.

Player A (the youngest, the smallest, ...) starts and chooses a card from player B, who then asks player A the question on the card. If player A answers the question correctly, he has "won" that card and can put it in front of him. If player A cannot answer the question correctly, then player B has "won" the card and can place it in front of him. The round continues clockwise according to the same system.

The winner is the first player to have a card of each color in front of him.

—user summary

Name: Schnitzeljagd
Description:
The traditional game similar to Chutes and Ladders. Players roll the dice and move along a path. One can also take shortcuts, but risks falling back again. The game ends when the player rolls the dice to move his piece to the target square or beyond.

—user summary

Name: Critical Mass: 5 card Promo Pack
Description:
A collection of 5 promo cards - some released previously.

Distortion Field -  The text on the card is "Target enemy mech’s weapons now have -1 firepower"

Missile Defense - The text on the card is "Disable this card to prevent any missile attack"

Plasma Drill (Dice Tower KS released 2019)

Reinforce (released 2019)

Power Transceiver (released 2019)

Name: Legends of the American Frontier: 3 Card Special Adventure Set
Description:
Three card set included with all Kickstarter-backer copies of Legends of the American Frontier, packaged outside the sealed game box.

Includes:
Architects of the Underground Railroad (Back East)
Rescue the Donner Party  (Far West)
Build One of the First Homesteads in Ohio Territory (Frontier)

Name: DUELS "au temps de la Grande Peste"
Description:
DUELS "au temps de la Grande Peste" is a simple skirmish miniature wargame that allows 2, 3, 4 or 5 players to compete to recognize their rights to the loot of an honest plunder. 
Each lord accompanied by a loyal captain and 9 warriors will have to implement a subtle strategy to get hold of the wealth scattered on a table of 1.20 m on the side.

The goal of the game is to control the maximum amount of loot at the end of the game.

Each session is played in four fixed turns at the end of which the victory points are calculated.
Player start by placing peasants and loot on the table. 
Depending on the initiative of your troop, you will choose your table edge. The last to choose his edge of the table will be the first to deploy but the first one to play in each turn.

Name: The Road Chosen
Description:
Welcome to The Road Chosen, a solitaire wargame where your choices impact every aspect of your command. Player decision making is at the heart of this print and play game. You command platoons of soldiers and armour across the Western Front landscape. You will encounter enemies, obstacles, good fortune and crippling bad luck at every turn as you try to reach your objective.

During a game you will command both infantry, tanks, support weapons and with the aid of artillery and air strikes progress across one (or more) of the maps on a chosen scenario. You will face stiff, defiant opposition in the enemy forces who are not going to give ground easily. You will need to make hard, tough choices weighing up options with the information you have and attempting to account for the unknown.

There are random event / enemy forces activity tables that you consult, after your roll your dice (2d6). You also roll 2d6 to receive Command Points each turn, that you can use to move, attack enemy forces in your areas, attempt reconnoiter into new areas, call for air & artillery support to help your units, and rally your units that have been suppressed in combat.

The game is quick to setup and play, it takes around 30 minutes to play a shorter game, to less than a couple of hours for a larger game and requires very little space.

You will be commanding either Allied or Axis forces of infantry and tanks against their enemies in a series of  narrative driven scenarios and campaign linking the scenarios together.

This is a solitaire game, and the 2d6 dice rolls and respective event and action tables will drive the direction and flow of the game.

Which road will _you_ chose?

Name: Birds of Prey: Airbattle RAG 5
Description:
Fly a new jet, wield a new missile, fly a new scenario. Airbattle RAG 5 is the product for everyone who enjoys the challenging world of jet dogfighting in Birds of Prey Air Combat in the Jet Age!

New jets to fly, test your skills in new scenarios, and unleash new missiles on your opponents!

Experience the dawn of the jet age over the Korean peninsula in early jet-powered war machines, with the F-86A-5 versus the original MiG-15 sans suffixe. Or fly the hostile skies of tomorrow with the F-35C versus the Su-35S in a kinematic dance over the Formosa Strait.

Airbattle RAG 5 spans over seventy years of combat jets between these two end-points, covering several jets in between, including Europe’s Tornado, the nuclear armed F-102A, and the iconic F-4D Phantom II. Teeth for these warplanes are provided by sixteen deadly new missile data cards.

BoP Convention 2018 scenarios from A Brief History of the U.S. Air Force each showcase an exemplar from five generations of American fighting jets. Start over the Korean Peninsula, soaring over Vietnam and battling in the Middle East.

Nukleur Conflict, Toe to Toe… features the scenarios from BoP Convention 2019, with a sometimes theatrical look at conflicts of nuclear powers, both real and imagined.

Whether missile or gun, technological terror or manual early jet, historical or flight of fancy… Airbattle RAG 5 will carry your Birds of Prey fight to new heights!u

—description from the publisher

"Birds of Prey Air Combat in the Jet Age!" is required for play!
Families: Game: Birds of Prey (Ad Astra Games)

Name: Don't Look Back: Sideshow Slaughter Expansion
Description:
Northwood hasn't seen a carnival in over two decades.  Something happened all those years ago that people in suburbs are still reluctant to talk about.  Recently some younger locals have been talking about hearing the sounds and seeing the lights of a small carnival off of Route 72, just north of the Sealy Line crossing.  Others say it's just a figment of their imagination.

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 1 "Booger" The Banished Killer miniature, 4 resin balloon token miniatures, and 2 custom scenarios to the base game.

Name: Roll Out!
Description:
Wexler Studios has rolled out a new dice game where the player who removes all the checkers wins!

Players roll two dice and turn over their or an opponent's labeled checkers marked 1-9. Similar to shut the box except that only the specific numbers on the dice or the combination total can be used on a player's or an opponent's checkers. (example: a player rolls double 6. He can only turn over his 6 and an opponent's 6 chip. If unable due to the chip having been collected, he has rolled out and his turn ends.)  Players can stop their turn after their first play or press their luck and continue rolling and turning over checkers.

Early 70's grand-tactical miniatures game of armored warfare on the East Front. Stands and model vehicles are platoons. Sighting rules, simultaneous movement (either via orders or map-plotting) and "Platoon Substitute Markers" provide some fog-of-war.

GDW Command Decision cites this game as an antecedant.

Name: Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight: Invasion Of The Saucer Kaiju Battlepack
Description:
Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight Invasion Of The Saucer Kaiju Battlepacks include 4 randomly selected Kaiju Battlecards (2 of which are new random 'Saucer Kaiju') , 3 random Zone cards (1 of which is a new Space Zone) , 2 Bonus Cards and rules!

This is a standalone pack and can also be integrated with any other Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight Battlecards.

Based on the original kaiju characters of game designer and manga artist Alex Strang, Hyper Battle Kaiju Fight is an action-packed (yet simple to play) monster-fighting game using large ‘Battlecards’.

Each player uses a Battlecard to represent their giant monster. The large-size illustrated card has all of the monster's abilities and strategic moves arranged on the back, using a unique tactical grid system for battling and tracking results.

Kaiju Battles can end in many ways, from total defeat (monster explode!), concession, running away, draws, and more.

Also: Circular Zone Cards represent various planets and other galactic environments that affect gameplay, and Bonus Cards provide surprising extra moves and events that can alter battles.

The game can be played with 2 players, and becomes even wild with multiple players.

Name: Hot Potatoz
Description:
Hot Potatoz is a take-that strategy card game about Potatoz, hotness, and being a little toxic (which is also pretty hot). Packed with Potatoz, puns, and pop culture for every kind of player.

Throughout the game, players take turns drawing and playing action cards to roast their friends, plan sneaky attacks, and stack their hands with the spiciest cards before a Potato Party starts. When someone plays a Potato Party card, players will use their cards to compete for tokens. Earn tokens by showing up with the hottest Potatoz or through soul-crushing sabotage. The first player to collect 5 tokens wins!

Hot Potatoz combines all of the excitement and tension of poker-like play, reading your friends and calling their bluff, with cutthroat action cards, big reveals, and chances to outsmart the competition. While the game can be learned in 5 minutes, making it accessible for the casual gamer, there are an endless number of strategies to be discovered for experienced players providing maximum replayability.

Can you take the heat or are you ready to get ROASTED??

—description from the publisher

Name: Palio: Il Gioco di Carte
Description:
Relive the atmosphere of the race but also the rivalry and magic of this extraordinary and unique event through an immediate and fun card game.

The game takes place in 16 rounds represented by 16 Path cards that highlight characteristic features of Piazza del Campo where the famous Palio race takes place. Some sections are repeated because the horses make 3 laps of the square. The first card represents "la mossa" or the start, while the last is "il bandierino" that is the end of the race.

The player who at the end of the last round finds himself with his district (contrada) in first position has won the Palio.

—user summary

Name: Spy Kid
Description:
At spy school, open your eyes and remember 5 drawings in 5 seconds !
Inspired by Kim’s game, Spy Kid is the perfect game for young spy training.

—description from the publisher

Quickly memorize the 5 drawings on the visible side of the card. Then, when the card is turned over, try to be the fastest one to identify the drawing that has changed. The game ends when a player reach 5 points.

Name: Das große Bauernhofspiel
Description:
Players collect rewards on a farm for correctly answered questions and help with the harvest. On his turn, the player rolls the dice and moves his piece to a harvest field or receives a question. The first to collect 8 rewards wins the game.

—user summary

Name: À toute vitesse
Description:
Slower or faster? You decide !

Have fun guessing and comparing the performances of 66 objects or living beings, from the turtle to the shooting star. Can a swallow outrun a motorcycle? Is a tennis ball faster than a helicopter? Does a parachutist go faster than a drakkar? You have a one in three chance of getting your card in the right place.

À Toute Vitesse is a game of deduction, comparison and knowledge on the theme of speed. Extend the experience by reading the documentary booklet that presents the 66 themes of the game.

The master of the game shows a card at random and hides the speed indication with his index finger.
The player who is asked to guess where he should place the card: is the object slower, faster or the same speed as one of the cards already on the table?â€† The player being questioned has 3 possibilities, but only one possible answer. With each turn, the game becomes more complicated, as the number of cards increases and the range of possibilities becomes wider and wider.

When a player make a mistake, he holds the card in front of him. When he have 5 cards (2 to 3 players) or 3 cards (4 players), he is eliminated from the game. The last player in play wins the game.

Adapted by Pierre Bellet from the children's book "À Toute Vitesse" by Cruschiform.

Name: Das große Polizeispiel
Description:
Players perform police missions in the city, and should work together to complete as many tasks as possible. The players start in the center of the plan; four events are revealed and these spaces on the plan are occupied with a deployment marker. In each round, four dice are rolled and each player gets one of them by agreement; he then moves his figure accordingly; for the die of his own color, twice as far. When a player reaches a deployment marker, it is removed; on color squares, only the player of the same color can remove it. If after such a round all events are used up and no deployment markers are on the map, everyone wins together.

—user summary

Name: Das große Baustellenspiel
Description:
We help on the construction site! Three tasks are on the table, everyone has three construction vehicles of one color. When it's your turn, you roll the dice - for a tool, you take it from the supply or from a fellow player, for a question mark, you take it only from the supply. If you have two matching tools for a task, you hand them over and place a construction vehicle on this section of the picture, also from another section. If the required number of vehicles - also several of a player - is in the section, you put a brick of your color into the house, you take the vehicle(s) back. When all tasks are completed, the player with the most bricks in the house wins.

—user summary

Name: Top Trumps Quiz: Marvel
Description:
Take another trip aboard the helicarrier and test your knowledge of the Avengers, Guardians of the Galaxy, S.H.I.E.L.D. and the dozens more characters that make up the massive Marvel Cinematic Universe in this special edition of Top Trumps Quiz - Marvel!

With questions on Captain Marvel, Peter Quill, Thor, Valkyrie, Gamora, Thanos and many more, you can revisit all of your favourite characters and places on your quest to prove yourself the ultimate fan!

500 puzzling and captivating questions that will test your knowledge and memory.

Name: とっとらりー (TToTT Rally)
Description:
The original TToTT (Table Tennis on The Table) has been transformed into a new, easy-to-play card game that anyone can master.

Enjoy a rally with Hello Kitty, Pocchaco, Cinamoroll, and your favorite Sanrio characters.

Give one player all the pink back cards and the other player all the blue back cards. Each player places two service cards in his or her playing area. Shuffle the rest of the cards and place each deck face down. Both players draw five cards from their decks into their hands.

Use rock, paper, scissors to determine the starting player. The starting player chooses one Service card to play and initiate the rally.

A player must chose a card from his or her hand that features a character shown on the bottom of the card played by his or her opponent.

Keep on playing back and forth. Each player should draw a card from his or her deck after a successful turn in order to maintain 5 cards in his or her hand.â€¨â€¨ If a player does not have a matching character, their opponent wins a point. The losing player then returns all the cards in his or her hand to the deck, reshuffles, and draws 5 new cards.

The serving player rotates with every point scored. Players can use any service card as they wish.

The first player to score seven points wins!

Name: Swing State Steal
Description:
Relax. It's just a board game.

This will go down as one of the strangest years in the country's history. And you get a chance to enjoy it again.
It's all here. The boat parades. The Pandemic. The Cancel Culture. The Riots. Left-wing Globalists. The Laptop!!
Such Fun!!

And let's not forget the cheating. Mail-in ballot cheating. Poll watcher cheating. Dead guys voting in droves!

Can the Incumbent president navigate public opinion, the Main-Stream-Media and win the swing votes he needs? Can he get them back after they've been stolen?

Swing State Steal is a premium quality product and the perfect consolation gift for the disheartened Republican.

Summary:
One player is the incumbent president, the other players represent swing states controlled by the opposite party.  The president is playing against all other players in the quest to collect votes.  Each state collects votes in their own color and the president is collecting votes in each of the opponent's colors.  At the end of the game, the president compares his collected votes with each of the states and whoever has more wins that state.  President needs to win a majority of the states to win the election.

The board is organized in four rounds:  The Campaign Round represents the time from the beginning of the year until election day, the Election day round, After the Polls Close and finally the Challenge Round.  First round is two laps, all other rounds are one lap.  Players roll a die to advance.

First three rounds are about collecting and stealing votes from the incumbent.  Any player can land on a Fake News space that has a story from the headlines (maybe) and an opportunity to take or give votes away.  Swing states can land on a Cheat space where they draw a cheat card.   The president can land on an Evidence space where he collects evidence cards for the final round.

States use Cheat cards to steal votes.  They are color coded and organized by rounds.  Green cheats (Campaign) are mail-in cheats, Blue (Election Day) are polling place cheats and Purple (After Polls Close) are big-time cheats.

The final round represents the weeks between Nov 3 and Jan 6 and is a card games.  The president presents evidence cards he has collected and the State have to play cheat cards they've played that match and return some votes.

On Jan 6th, the end of the game, is when all of the votes are tallied and a winner declared.

Name: Spel-tajm
Description:
In Spel-tajm players are traversing the game board trying to find the golden reflex rolling a die to move across the different paths and landing on spots with a token.

When flipping the tokens, players can't know what they will find, ranging from good to bad items. Only one of the tokens will show the golden reflex.

If you can find the golden reflex, and carrying it back to the start without anyone stealing the reflex you win the game.

Spel-tajm is basically a copy of Den fÃ¶rsvunna diamanten (Afrikan tÃ¤hti) with minor gameplay changes.

Name: Travel Light Travelers
Description:
This is the perfect game for anyone who enjoys traveling or travel-themed card games. It's a fun and easy to learn game with beautiful hand-painted artwork.

There are four suits: Site, Transport, Food & Lodging, and Activity, each with thirteen unique travel characters. The game will take you on a journey where you will meet these Travelers who add to the luggage you're carrying. Some Travelers may also help you discard luggage, some may help you weigh down your opponent with luggage and some may prevent you from discarding.

Your aim is to discard as much baggage as possible while weighing down your opponent with luggage. The game ends once one of you reaches the limit of the bags you can carry. The one who has travelled with the least baggage wins the game.

Name: Klondike: The Canadian Gold Rush Game
Description:
Klondike is a card drafting deck building game set in 1896 during the gold rush in The Yukon.

Play as 1 of 4 player characters. Shop at the mercantile to build your deck and improve your chances at successfully mining a creek in one of the four progressively more challenging mountain passes.

Players can use items they have purchased to impede their opponents or protect themselves from the other prospectors!

Win either by collecting the most gold or by having the best team of assistants. 60 minute average play time with options to shorten the game.

Name: Smash Up: Knights of the Round Table
Description: The Knights of the Round Table are going questing!  Their search for the Holy Grail will take them from base to base, as they complete quests that will help bring you closer to victory!
Families: Theme: King Arthur / The Knights of the Round Table / Camelot

Name: SGRUNT: Conquista la Sardegna
Description:
The world has ended...300 years have passed since the human race has disappeared...but a new race has taken its place, a warmongering race that can't wait to conquer all of Sardinia...the Boars!

Five tribes fight to control the land. In the thick of the woods, on the hot beaches or on the long abandoned roads, the only thing that each tribe wishes is to conquer the ancient territories of an increasingly wild and mysterious Sardinia.

One single cry unites all the ungulates: Sgrunt!

Prepare your plans to conquer all of Sardinia, guide your army of boars, choose the most strategic areas, use your army to corner your enemies in tight spots, where their numbers won't matter, and surround them until they're defeated!
The conquest of Sardinia is in your hooves!

Name: Código Ergo Sum
Description:
Código Ergo Sum is a game in which strategy and chance complement each other throughout the game. Each face on the side represents a reference to write on the game sheet, with the aim of establishing a code consisting only of 0 and 1 and thus help Oliver Cazz, the greatest hacker in history.


Players roll dice to generate a code consisting of 1's and 0's that matches the master code chosen at the beginning of the game.

You may choose freely where to start and continue freely across the grid, always respecting the indicated reference and using only empty spaces.

The grid must be completed turn after turn with 0 and 1,  until you cannot fulfill the referenced shape indicated by the dice.

Players who match the code exactly win; otherwise points are given for the closest matching code.

Name: Nº Problema
Description:
Nº Problema (No. Problem) is a game where strategy and chance are perfectly combined. The challenge is to complete as many boxes as possible, one time, with consecutive numbers. It begins by placing the N ° 1 in any box, starting a journey from box to box according to the reference indicated by the die. Número Problema offers two different game sheets, of 100 and 64 boxes respectively.


Fill in as many boxes as possible, one time only, with consecutive numbers.  Using 1 or 2 dice, players roll to find the reference (shape) corresponding to where you must write down a previous number on the grid + 1. You can rotate the shape.

The Reset box is used when we cannot complete the writing of a number + 1 in one turn. Each player can choose to cross out a box (up to four times) to continue in play. Each time we use this option we will subtract a point at the end of the game. If you have no Resets available, or do not choose to use it, the game is over.

Highest score wins.

Name: The Catnip Kid
Description:
An Old West Roll & Write for 1 - 4 Drifters

The Catnip Kid is out to collect the bounty on some no good thievin’ varmints. They been eatin’ cheese from here to the Rio Grande. Gonna take some plannin’ and a heap o’ luck to clean up these parts.

In this game, players earn points by rolling two 8-sided dice and writing the numbers in adjacent squares of their grids. Some spaces will give them resources that allow for special options. By filling a row or column with scoring sets, they earn points. Bonuses are available for the fastest draw, spinnin’ yarns and sheriff badges.

Name: Whoa Nelly
Description:
A wild western puzzle game for 2 - 4 players

Race to arrange your cards so they score the most points in this wild western, real-time puzzle game. The fastest cowpoke won’t always come out ahead, so aim for a balance of yer speed and wits.

There are no turns. The challenge is to play the cards so that scoring icons on the sides line up to earn the most points. Call STOP when all your cards are placed. Being quick on the draw and scorin’ high to boot will earn ya bonuses worth braggin’ about. Keep playing rounds until the target score is reached. At that time, the highest score wins!

There are two levels of play, for novice and experienced players.

Name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Currency of War
Description:
The Currency of War is the latest Learn to Play Set for the Legend of the Five Rings Collectible Card Game. With its fully comprehensive rules and play by play breakdown of your first game, it is an ideal entering point in the premiere Interactive Storyline Game.

Jump into the world of Rokugan as a member of the deadly and elegant Crane Clan or the fierce and adventurous Mantis Clan. Join the ranks of the samurai of the Emerald Empire, discover its rich and unique history and get ready to directly impact its future.

In this box you will find:

     2 Ivory legal and ready to play L5R CCG decks (one Crane, one Mantis)
     4 Ivory legal boosters to improve your deck.
     A 16-pages story book detailing the events of the conflict opposing both clans.
     A fully illustrated and comprehensive rulebook.
     An exclusive vote that will allow you to shape the future of Rokugan.


—description from the publisher
Families: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings

Name: Limbo: Saga of Noadin
Description:
Fight alongside the powerful Noadin who come from the North in order to resist the demontide. In the expansion you will get a whole new set of Heroes including the Lord Yasa, who controls a giant ice golem. Follow along as you tell countless stories within the Saga of Noadin.

The Saga of Noadin is a brand new army that will bring with it a new board game map as well as new models, cards and rules for their boards to use in the Core Game. You need a core game to use this add-on.

Name: Arydia: The Paths We Dare Tread – Epic Hunt
Description:
Epic Hunt will offer to players an exciting new challenge to overcome by adding to the game a new boss enemy.

The expansion box contains 1 pre-painted miniature, 27 cards, and 9 alternates of the skills contained within the base game.

Kickstarter exclusive mini-expansion.

Name: He Did What Heroes Do: Grand Tactical Wargame Rules for the Napoleonic Era
Description:
He Did What Heroes Do is a set of grand tactical rules for wargaming the Napoleonic Wars.

You don't just control a division or a corps, but an entire army. 
Your units on the tabletop will be infantry divisions, cavalry brigades and groups of artillery batteries, led by your subordinates. 
This wargame will allow you to play some of the largest battles of the wars in just a few hours. As the battle goes on, your commander in chief will rally wavering units, redeploy and push in reserves, or even change your subordinate's orders entirely.

He Did What Heroes Do has its focus on command, but the usual aspects of Napoleonic warfare will make an appearance. Skirmishers, heavy cavalry, square formations and grand batteries are all viable tactical options. 
All combat needs is just a few D6 to work out if your charging unit has broken through, your musket volleys are wearing the enemy down or if your artillery are hammering away effectively.

This game doesn't use cards, rolling on tables, distributing points or even command radii to decide which units you can use each turn. Every unit gets to activate once every turn, but they will only follow the orders you gave to their general. 
Want those cavalry to charge? 
Change their corps' orders, or move your commander to the unit and order them forward yourself! 
Or do you hang on for another turn, waiting until the enemy are even weaker? 
Your impact can be crucial, but you can't be everywhere at once. 
As the army commander, your focus will be on taking the initiative, supporting your subordinates and hopefully winning the day. 
Good luck general.

Designed to be played with 2 to 6mm, but can be adapted to other scales.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vintage Steam: A Heritage Rail Game
Description:
In Vintage Steam, players are managing a heritage railway. They will need to try to make it as appealing as possible, with a long track, plenty of locomotives and interesting scenery. Because at some point they will have to show the railway inspector just how good their railway is.

Every round players draft one card for every player. They can either play this card for it's effect or discard it for £2. Played
cards are either added to a players tableau or just used for some special effect like visitors to the railway.

The tableau is made up of track cards and complimentary cards tucked behind those cards. Players aim to be the first to have at least 5 track cards and a tucked locomotive so that they can play an inspector card to end the game.

Every body adds up the victory points on their tableau to discover who has the best heritage railway.

Name: Don't Look Back: Darkhearts Expansion
Description:
Not your typical Heroes...

Darkhearts -- a sinister character expansion.

Expand your games of Don't Look Back with these 4 new heroes. Complete with printed character cards, these characters will add new fresh playstyles and tactics to your fight against The Killer.

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 4 dark Hero character miniatures (Dante Darkheart, Stella Bell, The Twins, and The Cultist) and their rules to the base game.

Name: Avalonia
Description:
Theme — Avalonia is a fast paced strategic area control game. The story of Avalonia transpires in the lands of Avalon after King Arthur was betrayed and defeated by the four tribes, being left sedated on the Excalibur Tower. A plague was unleashed through the Excalibur, twisted most of the people into Variants. The four tribes — the Reapers, the Raiders, the Saviours and the Seekers, all thirst for power, endeavoured in hunting down the Untainted, using them to sustain the strength of the tribes. Now, a dreadful tribal war is embarked, never ending until someone crushes down the others and takes over the throne in Avalon.

Gameplay — Each player will lead a faction, aiming to expand their army, gain resources and conquer lands on the Avalon Map in order to be strong enough to defeat other factions. There are four phases for each round, the Planning Phase, Action Phase, King Arthur Phase and the Clean Up Phase. During the Action Phase, players have to decide their own combinations of actions to be taken from the 6 types of actions available. Over the course of the game, players have to win Artifact Units before the others, gain Pure Blood resources and eliminate troops from other factions. There are two ways of ending the game, either when the Throne Area of King Arthur is full or when one of the players has reached the ultimate score.

Objective — There are two ways to win the game, either be the first to reach 30 points, or fill up the research bar with blood tubes. In whichever ways that the game ends, the players count their victory points, whoever gets the highest victory points wins the game and becomes the new ruler of Avalon.

Name: Natives: Geister der Ahnen
Description:
Ancestral Spirits postcard expansion for Natives.   This card is placed next to the prairie pile at the start of the game.

Flavour text:

When the shaman invokes the ancestral spirits, they help the tribe rethink decisions made. And those who have the favor of the ancestors on their side will be protected by them when winter comes.

Rules:
Whenever a player takes one or more totems from the prairie, he receives the "Spirits of the Ancestors" card. The player may immediately assign one of his tribe members who are on his tribe card "Shaman" to another task.

Whoever owns the "Spirits of the Ancestors" at the end of the game does not lose any points for tribe members of foreign colors who are in his tribe.
